# Networking

> Making HTTP requests, working with sockets, and handling network protocols. Use `HttpClient` for REST APIs with `IHttpClientFactory` for proper lifecycle management. `System.Net.NetworkInformation` provides network availability monitoring; `System.Net.Sockets` enables low-level TCP/UDP communication.

- [Internet Protocol version 6 (IPv6) overview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/fundamentals/networking/ipv6-overview.md): Learn about the IPv6 protocol and how it differs from IPv4.
- [Network availability](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/fundamentals/networking/network-info.md): Learn how to detect changes in network availability and ping a host with .NET.
- [Network programming in .NET](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/fundamentals/networking/overview.md): Learn about various networking approaches for .NET app development.
- [WebSockets support in .NET](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/fundamentals/networking/websockets.md): Learn how to web sockets with the ClientWebSockets in .NET.
